Package fr.utt.lo02.projet.modele.formeTapis

Class Disposition

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
fr.utt.lo02.projet.modele.formeTapis.Disposition
All Implemented Interfaces:
Element
public class Disposition
extends java.util.Observable
implements Element
The class Disposition is used to define the layout of cards.

An object of this class has an attribute that holds the cards cartesTapis, an attribute that defines the layout of the cards formeTapis and other necessary attributes.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Dewen WU and Fulin ZHANG

  • Field Details

    • yx

      public final java.lang.Integer[][] yx
      The coordinates of the table. The tens digit represents the ordinate y, the units digit represents the abscissa x. The range of x and y is 1 to 5.

    • placerCarte

      public boolean placerCarte​(Carte carte, int[] xy, java.lang.String direction)
      The method of playing a card when the table is not empty for GUI
      Parameters:
      carte - The card wants to be played，
      xy - xy[0] stands for the abscissa x，xy[1] stands for the ordinate y
      direction - The direction of the card
      Returns:
      true if the card can be played

    • placerCarte

      xy - xy[0] stands for the abscissa x，xy[1] stands for the ordinate y

    • deplacerCarte

      public boolean deplacerCarte​(Carte carte, int[] xy, java.lang.String direction)
      The method of moving a card for GUI 
       Play the card if the condition is met. Then judge whether the layout 
 conforms to the the adjacency rule after placing the card. If it not 
 conforms, then the card just placed will be removed.
      Parameters:
      carte - The card wants to be moved，
      xy - xy[0] stands for the abscissa x，xy[1] stands for the ordinate y
      direction - The direction of the card
      Returns:
      true if the card can be played and the layout after placing the card conforms to the the adjacency rule

    • removeCarte

      public void removeCarte​(int pointMove)
      Remove a card specified by a coordinate.
      Parameters:
      pointMove - The coordinate of the card wants to be moved

    • afficherLesCartes

      public void afficherLesCartes()
      Update the display of the cards in table for GUI.

    • jouerCarte

      public void jouerCarte​(Carte carte)
      The method of playing a card for the command line 
       If the table is empty, choose any coordinate to put the card; otherwise the
 player needs to choose a card on the table first, and then choose one of the
 directions (top, bottom, left and right) of that card to play.
      Parameters:
      carte - The card wants to be played

    • moveCarte

      public void moveCarte()
      The method of moving a card for the command line 
       If there are less than 2 cards on the table, the player cannot move the card;
 otherwise, the player needs to select a card wants to be moved first, then
 choose a card on the table and then choose one of the directions (top,
 bottom, left and right) of that card to play.
 
 Play the card if the condition is met. Then judge whether the layout 
 conforms to the the adjacency rule after placing the card. If it not 
 conforms, then the card just placed will be removed.

    • getNombreCartes

      public int getNombreCartes()

    • peutEtreDeplacee

      public boolean peutEtreDeplacee()
      Judge whether the layout conforms to the the adjacency rule after placing the card. 
       Use a 5*5 array yx. yx[i][j], i means the ith row, j means the jth column, if
 the value of yx[i][j] is equal to 1, then there is a card in this position,
 else this position is empty. 
 Then determine in turn whether each position with a value of 1 in the array 
 xy can be connected to all other positions with a value of 1 by using the 
 method checkPass().
      Returns:
      true if each position with a value of 1 in the array xy can be connected to all other positions with a value of 1

    • checkPass

      public boolean checkPass​(int[][] map, int[][] visited, int[] points)
      Determine whether the two points x1y1 and x2y2 are connected. Two points are connected, which means that at least one of the four directions of one point can form a path with the other point. 
       1. Recursive search to determine whether the values of x1y1 up, down, left,
 and right are equal to itself 
 2. If there is an equal direction, take the coordinate of this direction as 
 x1y1 and repeat the step 1 
 3. If recursively to the coordinates of x1y1 equal to the coordinates of x2y2, 
 return true and end the search; otherwise return false.
      Parameters:
      map - Two-dimensional array of square matrix
      visited - Indicates whether the corresponding point has been visited
      points - Two points that need to be queried
      Returns:
      true if two points are connected

    • setFormeTapis

      public void setFormeTapis​(FormeTapis formeTapis)
      Define the shape of the layout
      Parameters:
      formeTapis - A shape of the layout object
